resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
{code}
Insufficient package version (submitted: 6.0.0.9000, existing: 6.0.1)
  Version contains large components (6.0.0.9000)
  
  Days since last update: 2
{code}
  

when running

https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/r/tests/testthat/test-install-arrow.R

see logs for https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/11747
fields.summary: [R] Bump dev version following 6.0.1 patch release

comments.body:
This is likely a caching issue 
- https://github.com/actions/cache/issues/2
- https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63521430/clear-cache-in-github-actions
- https://docs.github.com/en/actions/advanced-guides/caching-dependencies-to-speed-up-workflows

Seems an update of Arrow version that gets built is needed. Maybe the latest source from CRAN should be downloaded rather than checking if the version being built corresponds to the latest version on CRAN.

It's not a caching issue, we need to bump versions after doing the patch release because the patch release branch doesn't get merged to master. I have another fix to pull over from the patch release branch, I'll handle this.
